**Orange dragon scale mail** is a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [dragon hide](/wiki/Dragon_hide "Dragon hide") like all [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.5 FIQHack](#FIQHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Orange dragon scale mail is not randomly generated. Reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") that targets worn [orange dragon scales](/wiki/Orange_dragon_scales "Orange dragon scales") will convert them into mail, with a blessed scroll adding a point of [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment").

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") that are not [monks](/wiki/Monk_\(player_monster\) "Monk (player monster)") generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") have a 1⁄9 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") orange dragon scale mail as their initial body armor before role-specific replacements.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

While worn, orange dragon scale mail confers 9 base AC and [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"). Uncontrolled [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing orange dragon scale mail will revert them to scales and turn the wearer into a [orange dragon](/wiki/Orange_dragon "Orange dragon").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit ef1eeed7](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ef1eeed7550e38fa1e4ff0ef608f3c8b55eaa950), both the scales and scale mail also provide [free action](/wiki/Free_action "Free action").

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail")*

Orange dragon scale mail is somewhat more useful at a glance compared to some other colors of dragon mail: many of the items, [traps](/wiki/Trap "Trap") and attacks that can put a character to [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep") are not able to be countered by [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") other than the breath weapon and [wand of sleep](/wiki/Wand_of_sleep "Wand of sleep"). Being put to sleep is also quite deadly in its own right, as many monsters can get in several attacks before you wake up, and there are relatively few other extrinsic sources of the resistance - a [ring of free action](/wiki/Ring_of_free_action "Ring of free action") only protects against the [potion of sleeping](/wiki/Potion_of_sleeping "Potion of sleeping") and its vapors.

With this in mind, there are many [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") that provide intrinsic sleep resistance in some form, particularly those of [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") monsters, and [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") characters obtain the intrinsic at [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 4. Once a long-term source of the property is obtained, orange dragon scale mail is generally unlikely to see use. One use case involving the dragon mail is a non-elven [foodless](/wiki/Foodless "Foodless") [atheist](/wiki/Atheist "Atheist") character, who has much fewer means to obtain the property and is at particularly high risk from [sleeping gas traps](/wiki/Sleeping_gas_trap "Sleeping gas trap").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Orange dragon scale mail is more likely to be considered for characters since it confers free action: this can free up a vital [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") slot for a character not reliant on body armor for reflection or [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance").

## History

Orange dragon scale mail first appears with most other colors of dragon scale mail in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"). From NetHack 3.0.0 to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), including variants based on those versions, orange dragon scale mail is created by polymorphing the corpse of a orange dragon. Orange dragon scales are introduced in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"), along with the current method for converting them into dragon scale mail.

## Variants

- *Main article: [Dragon-scaled armor](/wiki/Dragon-scaled_armor "Dragon-scaled armor")*

In some variants, dragon scale mail is phased out in favor of dragon-scaled armor, whose implementation is based on a proposal by dtsund. Instead of being made into mail of its own, dragon scales are treated as a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), and reading a scroll of enchant armor melds them onto a worn set of body armor, generally augmenting that armor by adding its AC and conferred extrinsic properties to it. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

Several variants also give orange dragon scale mail additional properties while worn, and may even introduce other forms of orange dragon scale armor. Variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties") may also make orange dragon mail and other colors more worthwhile.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [gnoll warriors](/wiki/Gnoll_warrior "Gnoll warrior") have a 1⁄20 chance of generating with orange dragon scale mail.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), worn orange dragon scale mail [passively](/wiki/Passive "Passive") inflicts [slowing](/wiki/Slowing "Slowing") on attackers.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in each game - to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify") on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon. Only wishes from a [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing") can create dragon scale mail directly.

Orange dragon scale mail is effectively replaced by **sleep dragon scale mail**, which confers only 5 base AC like all dragon scale mail in UnNetHack.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Dragon armor (dNetHack)](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), worn orange dragon scale mail additionally confers free action and [hallucination resistance](/wiki/Hallucination_resistance "Hallucination resistance").

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), worn orange dragon scale mail additionally confers free action. It also weighs 300 aum like all dragon scale mail in FIQHack (which is halved while worn).

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 156](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L156): *initial body armor for Astral playermons is random DSM, with equal probability for each*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 501](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L501)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 518](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L518)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [makemon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 691](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c#line691 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c")
